Related Hyperbolic Functions

Given the trigonometric functions \(\cos x,\sin x\) related functions can be defined; \(\tan x, \sec x, \rm cosec\) \(x\) through the relations: \(\tan x \equiv\dfrac{\sin x}{\cos x}\qquad \sec x\equiv\dfrac{1}{\cos x}\qquad{\rm cosec}\ x\equiv\dfrac{1}{\sin x}\qquad\cot x\equiv\dfrac{\cos x}{\sin x}\).

In an analogous way, given \(\cosh x\) and \(\sinh x\) we can introduce hyperbolic functions. These functions are defined in the following Key Point.

Key Point: Further hyperbolic functions

\(\tanh x \equiv \dfrac{\sinh x}{\cosh x}\)

\(\rm sech\) \(x \equiv \dfrac{1}{\cosh x}\)

\(\rm cosech\) \(x \equiv \dfrac{1}{\sinh x}\)

\(\coth x \equiv \dfrac{\cosh x}{\sinh x}\)
